instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing parts - but I dont know which?
threads.message:
Hi guys

I got a liquid spilled MacBook 12 inch retina newest model. The board is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> but I cannot find schematics and board view for it anywhere online.

It is missing three components which were totally burned. It had a lot of "pigeon poo" looking stuff around the whole area marked with a red box in attached picture and after cleaning the three components marked with red circles were completely missing or burned beyond recognition.

My question is now - do anyone know the missing components and their readings?

Link to full size pic: [URL]http://i65.tinypic.com/29xhzcz.jpg[/URL]

[IMG]http://i65.tinypic.com/29xhzcz.jpg[/IMG]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing parts - but I dont know which?
threads.message: I can check in a few days, I am not home right now. If you don't have an answer on Tuesday bump up the topic so I don't forget.

threads.message:
Hi Duke.

Thanks. Did you get the time to check this?

threads.message: The 12" macbook I have here has a different component layout. Sorry can't help with this.

Question still open if somebody else should happen to have one of these lying around...
